meanings.definition: Material used to fill in an excavated area.
meanings.sent1: The backfills were brought in to complete the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The workers dumped the backfills into the pit to level the ground.
meanings.sent3: The backfills decided to have a party in the hole.
meanings.sent4: The backfills flowed like a river into the empty space.
meanings.sent5: The backfills resembled a giant puzzle coming together in the pit.

meanings.definition: To fill in an excavated area with material.
meanings.sent1: They backfills the hole with dirt to make it safe.
meanings.sent2: She backfills the trench with gravel to support the pipes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel backfills its burrow with nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Time backfills our memories with new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The chef backfills the pastry with delicious cream.

meanings.definition: The act of filling in an excavated area with material.
meanings.sent1: The backfills proceeded smoothly after the excavation.
meanings.sent2: His backfills were essential to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The backfills threw a surprise party in the pit.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter backfills the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The music backfills the empty space with beautiful melodies.
